values.description:
The manager interface is based on on [this wiki page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/11599873/Ignition+Sensors) and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The `Manager` loads `Sensor`s as plugins. Sensors are initialized from a `<sensor>` tag. Anyone can write a custom sensor plugin, but there will also be built-in plugins. The only built-in plugin in this PR is a camera plugin. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which uses a camera sensor and to save a png.


TODO for future PRs:

* Port the Distortion class
* Update SDF to support more camera parameters via SDF (antialiasing, verticalFOV)
* Support removing a camera from the ignition rendering scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?
* How should `<visualize>` be handled?
* Unit tests for `CameraConfig`
* Find a sensor by name
* `CameraConfig` should have `FromSDF()` and `CameraSensor` should use it.
* `CameraConfig` should include pixel format when writing `ToSDF()`
* Camera should do something with `<noise>` and `<lens>`
values.title: Manager with Camera sensor and example

The `Manager` loads `Sensor`s as plugins. Sensors are initialized from a `<sensor>` tag. Anyone can write a custom sensor plugin, but there will also be built-in plugins. The only built-in plugin in this PR is a camera plugin. Lastly there is a `save_image` example which uses a camera sensor and to save a png.


TODO for future PRs:

* Support removing a camera from the ignition rendering scene
* Where do frames come in?
* What to do with `<always_on>` tag?

summary.html:
The manager interface is based on on this wiki page and the Gazebo sensors manager.

The Manager loads Sensors as plugins. Sensors are initialized from a <sensor> tag. Anyone can write a custom sensor plugin, but there will also be built-in plugins. The only built-in plugin in this PR is a camera plugin. Lastly there is a save_image example which uses a camera sensor and to save a png.

TODO for future PRs:

  • Port the Distortion class
  • Update SDF to support more camera parameters via SDF (antialiasing, verticalFOV)
  • Support removing a camera from the ignition rendering scene
  • Where do frames come in?
  • What to do with <always_on> tag?
  • How should <visualize> be handled?
  • Unit tests for CameraConfig
  • Find a sensor by name
  • CameraConfig should have FromSDF() and CameraSensor should use it.
  • CameraConfig should include pixel format when writing ToSDF()
  • Camera should do something with <noise> and <lens>

values.description:
The major changes are:

1. Simplify the process of creating a sensor when the sensor type is known:

    `auto cameraSensor = mgr.CreateSensor<ignition::sensors::CameraSensor>(cameraSDF);`


2. Removed Manager pointer within the Sensor class.

3. Rely on ign-msgs1, and non-stamped messages.
values.title: A bit of code refactor

summary.raw:
The major changes are:

1. Simplify the process of creating a sensor when the sensor type is known:

    `auto cameraSensor = mgr.CreateSensor<ignition::sensors::CameraSensor>(cameraSDF);`


2. Removed Manager pointer within the Sensor class.

3. Rely on ign-msgs1, and non-stamped messages.
summary.html:
The major changes are:

  1. Simplify the process of creating a sensor when the sensor type is known:

    auto cameraSensor = mgr.CreateSensor<ignition::sensors::CameraSensor>(cameraSDF);

  2. Removed Manager pointer within the Sensor class.

  3. Rely on ign-msgs1, and non-stamped messages.

values.description:
This PR includes a generic Lidar class based on GpuRaySensor and RaySensor classes. The idea is to have a parent class for CPU and GPU classes that defines the common methods and interfaces for a Lidar.  
  
Each child class can override the Update method to create the scan data based on CPU/GPU or any method.  
  
It also includes a basic unit test that creates the lidar sensor from a SDF.  
  
I will create a follow up PR with a GPU lidar implementation.
values.title: Add generic Lidar sensor class

summary.raw:
This PR includes a generic Lidar class based on GpuRaySensor and RaySensor classes. The idea is to have a parent class for CPU and GPU classes that defines the common methods and interfaces for a Lidar.  
  
Each child class can override the Update method to create the scan data based on CPU/GPU or any method.  
  
It also includes a basic unit test that creates the lidar sensor from a SDF.  
  
I will create a follow up PR with a GPU lidar implementation.
summary.html:
This PR includes a generic Lidar class based on GpuRaySensor and RaySensor classes. The idea is to have a parent class for CPU and GPU classes that defines the common methods and interfaces for a Lidar.

Each child class can override the Update method to create the scan data based on CPU/GPU or any method.

It also includes a basic unit test that creates the lidar sensor from a SDF.

I will create a follow up PR with a GPU lidar implementation.

values.description:
This PR makes possible to use Ogre2 with camera example and camera tests.

It is inspired from on going work on using ogre2 and ogre1 at the same time with [ign-rendering](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/115/enable-ogre2-tests/diff).

It is also possible to select which engine should be used for the tests like it is done [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/124/work-with-new-ogre2-debs/diff). But I added some automatic configurations [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/25/use-ogre2-with-camera-example-and-tests/diff#Ltest/test_config.h.inT14) so the default values are based on which version of Ogre \(1.9 or 2.1\) is installed.
values.title: Use Ogre2 with camera example and tests

summary.raw:
This PR makes possible to use Ogre2 with camera example and camera tests.

It is inspired from on going work on using ogre2 and ogre1 at the same time with [ign-rendering](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/115/enable-ogre2-tests/diff).

It is also possible to select which engine should be used for the tests like it is done [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/124/work-with-new-ogre2-debs/diff). But I added some automatic configurations [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/25/use-ogre2-with-camera-example-and-tests/diff#Ltest/test_config.h.inT14) so the default values are based on which version of Ogre \(1.9 or 2.1\) is installed.
summary.html:
This PR makes possible to use Ogre2 with camera example and camera tests.

It is inspired from on going work on using ogre2 and ogre1 at the same time with ign-rendering.

It is also possible to select which engine should be used for the tests like it is done here. But I added some automatic configurations here so the default values are based on which version of Ogre (1.9 or 2.1) is installed.

values.description:
Without this, the following command:

`cmake .. -DBUILD_TESTING=false`

Fails with:

~~~
CMake Error at test/integration/CMakeLists.txt:20 (target_link_libraries):
  Cannot specify link libraries for target "INTEGRATION_camera_plugin" which
  is not built by this project.
~~~

This PR has all tests linking against all libraries. If that's undesired, I can split the call to `ign_build_tests` for each test.
values.title: Support BUILD_TESTING=false

Without this, the following command:

cmake .. -DBUILD_TESTING=false

Fails with:

CMake Error at test/integration/CMakeLists.txt:20 (target_link_libraries):
  Cannot specify link libraries for target "INTEGRATION_camera_plugin" which
  is not built by this project.

This PR has all tests linking against all libraries. If that's undesired, I can split the call to ign_build_tests for each test.

values.description:
Updated CMake to create plugins as components.

Linking is now done against targets. This change also allows the package build in catkin ws / colcon environments.

Requires ign-cmake [pull request #126](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/126) which fixes ign-rendering component targets.
values.title: Componentize plugins

summary.raw:
Updated CMake to create plugins as components.

Linking is now done against targets. This change also allows the package build in catkin ws / colcon environments.

Requires ign-cmake [pull request #126](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/126) which fixes ign-rendering component targets.
summary.html:
Updated CMake to create plugins as components.

Linking is now done against targets. This change also allows the package build in catkin ws / colcon environments.

Requires ign-cmake pull request #126 which fixes ign-rendering component targets.

values.description:
List of modifications:

* Use full namespace for common
* Empty definitions for GaussiaNoisemodel class
* Update gtest to 1.8.1
* Use IGN\_PI instead of M\_PI
* Visibility for sensors and fixes for std::accumulate
* Final fixes: near/far is a reserved word

**Important:** there were some missing definitions in different class methods. I added a fake definition in the .hh header but probably the design intention was other. Please check them.

Tested here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_sensors-pr-win&build=10)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_sensors-pr-win/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_sensors-pr-win/10/))
values.title: Windows fixes to make ign-sensor to compile

values.description:
Changes required to include gpu ray sensor into ign-gazebo.

We need to decide if we are going to keep gpu\_ray as a sdf definition or we are going to change it. In my opinion it is worth to change it, so gpu ray is only used for ignitnion rendering and gpu lidar is a more accurate name for the sensor.   
  
Gpu ray can be used also for sonars and radars. So I think we should decouple it from the lidar sensor.   
  
If you are ok with it @nkoenig I can change it in the sdformat.
values.title: Changes required for ing-gazebo for gpu ray

summary.raw:
Changes required to include gpu ray sensor into ign-gazebo.

We need to decide if we are going to keep gpu\_ray as a sdf definition or we are going to change it. In my opinion it is worth to change it, so gpu ray is only used for ignitnion rendering and gpu lidar is a more accurate name for the sensor.   
  
Gpu ray can be used also for sonars and radars. So I think we should decouple it from the lidar sensor.   
  
If you are ok with it @nkoenig I can change it in the sdformat.
summary.html:
Changes required to include gpu ray sensor into ign-gazebo.

We need to decide if we are going to keep gpu_ray as a sdf definition or we are going to change it. In my opinion it is worth to change it, so gpu ray is only used for ignitnion rendering and gpu lidar is a more accurate name for the sensor.

Gpu ray can be used also for sonars and radars. So I think we should decouple it from the lidar sensor.

If you are ok with it @nkoenig I can change it in the sdformat.

values.description:
Consumers of Ignition Sensors, such as Ignition Gazebo, will want to interact with the underlying rendering objects. I think it makes sense to expose them directly instead of duplicating the whole API, which doesn't scale well.

An argument against this would be if we're planning to make Ignition Sensors agnostic of rendering framework. But considering that the `CameraSensor` class API already exposes Ignition Rendering, I suspect that may not be the case.

---

I also removed a public function that is not implemented and was being used in Ignition Gazebo by mistake.

I'd like us to put in place a policy against this kind of API stub since I believe it brings no benefit and has multiple bad consequences. Historically, such stubs tend to be left unimplemented, causing frustration to end users and extra effort from developers to tick-tock it out of the API. I could be convinced to leave them if we committed to doing thorough API reviews before releases though.

---

This will be used in an `ign-gazebo` PR, I'll add the link here soon.
values.title: Expose rendering camera and remove unimplemented API

summary.raw:
Consumers of Ignition Sensors, such as Ignition Gazebo, will want to interact with the underlying rendering objects. I think it makes sense to expose them directly instead of duplicating the whole API, which doesn't scale well.

An argument against this would be if we're planning to make Ignition Sensors agnostic of rendering framework. But considering that the `CameraSensor` class API already exposes Ignition Rendering, I suspect that may not be the case.

---

I also removed a public function that is not implemented and was being used in Ignition Gazebo by mistake.

I'd like us to put in place a policy against this kind of API stub since I believe it brings no benefit and has multiple bad consequences. Historically, such stubs tend to be left unimplemented, causing frustration to end users and extra effort from developers to tick-tock it out of the API. I could be convinced to leave them if we committed to doing thorough API reviews before releases though.

---

This will be used in an `ign-gazebo` PR, I'll add the link here soon.
summary.html:
Consumers of Ignition Sensors, such as Ignition Gazebo, will want to interact with the underlying rendering objects. I think it makes sense to expose them directly instead of duplicating the whole API, which doesn't scale well.

An argument against this would be if we're planning to make Ignition Sensors agnostic of rendering framework. But considering that the CameraSensor class API already exposes Ignition Rendering, I suspect that may not be the case.

I also removed a public function that is not implemented and was being used in Ignition Gazebo by mistake.

I'd like us to put in place a policy against this kind of API stub since I believe it brings no benefit and has multiple bad consequences. Historically, such stubs tend to be left unimplemented, causing frustration to end users and extra effort from developers to tick-tock it out of the API. I could be convinced to leave them if we committed to doing thorough API reviews before releases though.

This will be used in an ign-gazebo PR, I'll add the link here soon.

values.description:
Added logical camera sensor class that detects objects within its frustum.  The current implementation checks the sensor frustum against points. Bounding box checks will be added in the future when needed.

Also started refactoring the senor manager class with the intention of supporting better integration with ign-gazebo. The functionality for loading sensor plugins have been extracted out into it’s own SensorFactory class. The logical camera sensor integration test demonstrates creating sensors directly using a sensor factory.
values.title: Add logical camera sensor

summary.raw:
Added logical camera sensor class that detects objects within its frustum.  The current implementation checks the sensor frustum against points. Bounding box checks will be added in the future when needed.

Also started refactoring the senor manager class with the intention of supporting better integration with ign-gazebo. The functionality for loading sensor plugins have been extracted out into it’s own SensorFactory class. The logical camera sensor integration test demonstrates creating sensors directly using a sensor factory.
summary.html:
Added logical camera sensor class that detects objects within its frustum. The current implementation checks the sensor frustum against points. Bounding box checks will be added in the future when needed.

Also started refactoring the senor manager class with the intention of supporting better integration with ign-gazebo. The functionality for loading sensor plugins have been extracted out into it’s own SensorFactory class. The logical camera sensor integration test demonstrates creating sensors directly using a sensor factory.

values.description: Previously each sensor object was a plugin, which means the sensor object is tied to the lifecycle of the plugin, and vice versa. This PR proposes to separate the implementation of a sensor plugin from a sensor object . Once a sensor plugin \(e.g. ignition-sensors-camera-sensor.so\) is loaded, it can be used to instantiate sensor objects of the given type \(e.g. CameraSensor\). We can now safely delete a sensor object without having to unload the plugin itself.
values.title: Refactor sensor plugins

summary.raw: Previously each sensor object was a plugin, which means the sensor object is tied to the lifecycle of the plugin, and vice versa. This PR proposes to separate the implementation of a sensor plugin from a sensor object . Once a sensor plugin \(e.g. ignition-sensors-camera-sensor.so\) is loaded, it can be used to instantiate sensor objects of the given type \(e.g. CameraSensor\). We can now safely delete a sensor object without having to unload the plugin itself.
summary.html: Previously each sensor object was a plugin, which means the sensor object is tied to the lifecycle of the plugin, and vice versa. This PR proposes to separate the implementation of a sensor plugin from a sensor object . Once a sensor plugin (e.g. ignition-sensors-camera-sensor.so) is loaded, it can be used to instantiate sensor objects of the given type (e.g. CameraSensor). We can now safely delete a sensor object without having to unload the plugin itself.

values.description: This PR fixes depth camera for ogre 2 and its test \(which was being skipped\). It also makes all the changes necessary to get Depth Camera sensor working in ign-gazebo.
values.title: Fix test for ogre2

summary.raw: This PR fixes depth camera for ogre 2 and its test \(which was being skipped\). It also makes all the changes necessary to get Depth Camera sensor working in ign-gazebo.
summary.html: This PR fixes depth camera for ogre 2 and its test (which was being skipped). It also makes all the changes necessary to get Depth Camera sensor working in ign-gazebo.

summary.html: It complains about the uninitialized variable

values.description:
The goal here is to separate out the classes and functions that require ign-rendering into it’s own component in ign-sensors so that the core of the sensor library is independent of ign-rendering.

The main challenge is that we cannot just remove existing functions and we need to go through a tick-tock cycle. So the ign-rendering dependent functions are being deprecated in ign-sensors2 and the ign-rendering dependency removal can only be complete in ign-sensors3.

Main changes are:

* added new `rendering` component that contains a base RenderingSensor class
* DepthCamera, GpuLidar classes are now derived from RenderingSensor
* rendering/scene related functions in `Manager` and `Sensor` classes are being deprecated
values.title: Separate out rendering sensor classes and functions from core sensor library

summary.raw:
The goal here is to separate out the classes and functions that require ign-rendering into it’s own component in ign-sensors so that the core of the sensor library is independent of ign-rendering.

The main challenge is that we cannot just remove existing functions and we need to go through a tick-tock cycle. So the ign-rendering dependent functions are being deprecated in ign-sensors2 and the ign-rendering dependency removal can only be complete in ign-sensors3.

Main changes are:

* added new `rendering` component that contains a base RenderingSensor class
* DepthCamera, GpuLidar classes are now derived from RenderingSensor
* rendering/scene related functions in `Manager` and `Sensor` classes are being deprecated
summary.html:
The goal here is to separate out the classes and functions that require ign-rendering into it’s own component in ign-sensors so that the core of the sensor library is independent of ign-rendering.

The main challenge is that we cannot just remove existing functions and we need to go through a tick-tock cycle. So the ign-rendering dependent functions are being deprecated in ign-sensors2 and the ign-rendering dependency removal can only be complete in ign-sensors3.

Main changes are:

  • added new rendering component that contains a base RenderingSensor class
  • DepthCamera, GpuLidar classes are now derived from RenderingSensor
  • rendering/scene related functions in Manager and Sensor classes are being deprecated

values.description:
Several tests are failing to run on homebrew, but they are all listed as `Results.test_ran`.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-acropolis/job/ignition_sensors-ci-ign-sensors1-homebrew-amd64/3/testReport/

This was originally fixed in [gazebo pull request 413](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/413/display-name-of-tests-that-dont-run-in/diff) but not propagated. I'll make an issue to install the `check_test_ran.py` script from `ign-cmake`.
values.title: Show name for tests that failed to run
